thread.title: Nick Grimshaw undergoes DRASTIC haircut and looks completely different with short hair
thread.title_full: Nick Grimshaw undergoes DRASTIC haircut and looks completely different with short hair

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Nick Grimshaw undergoes DRASTIC haircut and looks completely different with short hair
text:
Nick Grimshaw undergoes DRASTIC haircut and looks completely different with short hair Radio 1 presenter has gone for the chop Share   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Nick Grimshaw is well known for his lustrous head of dark hair. 
But now the Radio 1 breakfast show presenter has undergone a shock transformation – chopping off his famous locks. 
Appearing in new photos to promote Red Nose Day , the 32 year old has a close crop with shaved sides. (Photo: ITV) It accompanied him everywhere (Photo: Wenn) (Photo: PA) 
Wearing a red and black striped mohair jumper, Nick goes for a grungy look. 
Singer Pixie Geldof , 26, TV host ­ Caroline Flack , 37, and Radio 1’s Nick Grimshaw, 32, have all registered their four-legged friends with Pedigree Money – an offshoot of Money Management. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Nick Grimshaw's dogs Pig and Stinky (Photo: Collect Unknown) Nick's famous quiff has also had a spell in the blonde realm (Photo: Instagram) Dreaming of platinum 
The agency’s website says it “manages the media and commercial interests of cutting edge non-human talent”. 
Grimmy ’s two dogs Staffy/English bull terrier Pig and pug/Jack Russell cross Stinky Baby, both from Battersea Dogs Home, have their “true rags to riches fairytale” life detailed on the site. 
Two-year-old Pig’s agent describes how she was “catapulted to stardom” when she inspired her master’s sellout Topman clothing collection. Nick Grimshaw thinks his dogs have talent 
She has since appeared on The X Factor and “become accustomed to her personal life being frequently discussed on the Radio 1 Breakfast Show”. 
Six-month-old Stinky Baby is des­­cribed as “the Bieber to [Pig’s] Usher”, with the young pup “learning the tricks of the trade from his mentor”. One last look
